xxl.io
Class ListStreamQueue

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.collections.AbstractQueue
        |
        +--xxl.io.StreamQueue
              |
              +--xxl.io.ListStreamQueue
public class ListStreamQueue
extends StreamQueue
implements FIFOQueue

This class provides a stream queue that stores the bytes of its serialized elements in a ListQueue. Neither the peek method nor the remove method are implemented by this queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new list stream queue with ...

     ListStreamQueue queue = new ListStreamQueue(

         // an integer converter

         IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

         // an input buffer size of 4 bytes (size of an integer)

         new Constant(4),

         // an output buffer size of 4 bytes (size of an integer)

         new Constant(4)
     );

     // insert the integer from 0 to 9 into the queue

     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
         queue.insert(new Integer(i));

     // print five elements of the queue

     int i = 0;
     while (i < 5 && queue.hasNext()) {
         i = ((Integer)queue.next()).intValue();
         System.out.println(i);
     }

     // insert the integers from 20 to 29

     for (i = 20; i < 30; i++)
         queue.insert(new Integer(i));

     // print all elements of the queue

     while (queue.hasNext())
         System.out.println(queue.next());

See Also:
Constant, FIFOQueue, Function, InputStream, ListQueue, OutputStream, Queue

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new ListStreamQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with an array (parameter list) (for further details see Function) of objects. The array (parameter list) will be used for initializing the list stream queue by calling the constructor ListStreamQueue((Function) array[0], new Constant(0), new Constant(0)).
See Also:
Function

queue

protected Queue queue
A queue that is internally used for storing the bytes of the serialized elements of this queue.

inputStream

protected InputStream inputStream
The input stream is used for reading the serialized elements of the queue. It is set to an input stream, that takes the next Integer object from queue and returns its int value.

outputStream

protected OutputStream outputStream
The output stream that is used for writing serialized elements to the queue. It is set to an output stream, that inserts an Integer object wrapping the specified int value into queue.
Constructor Detail

ListStreamQueue

public ListStreamQueue(Converter converter,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new list stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
Parameters:
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

ListStreamQueue

public ListStreamQueue(Converter converter,
                       Function newObject,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new list stream queue that uses the specified converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of ListStreamQueue(new UniformConverter(converter, newObject), inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
Parameters:
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

ListStreamQueue

public ListStreamQueue(Function newObject,
                       Function inputBufferSize,
                       Function outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new list stream queue that uses a convertable converter for serializing and de-serializing its elements. The factory method is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the output stream is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.
This constructor is equivalent to the call of ListStreamQueue(ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE, newObject, inputBufferSize, outputBufferSize).
Parameters:
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the input stream is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
See Also:
ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE
Method Detail

inputStream

protected InputStream inputStream()
Opens an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue and returns it.
This implementation simply returns inputStream.
Overrides:
inputStream in class StreamQueue
Returns:
an input stream for reading the serialized elements of the queue.

outputStream

protected OutputStream outputStream()
Opens an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue and returns it.
This implementation simply returns outputStream.
Overrides:
outputStream in class StreamQueue
Returns:
an output stream for writing serialized elements to the queue.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
This implementation simply clear queue and sets size to 0.
Overrides:
clear in class StreamQueue

close

public void close()
Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
This implementation simply closes queue.
Overrides:
close in class StreamQueue

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a ListStreamQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of a ListStreamQueue.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
